Key Match Events: Bobby Portis delivered his best performance of the season, tallying 21 points and a massive 18 rebounds.
Damian Lillard showcased his scoring prowess, putting up 36 points along with seven assists.
A costly half-court violation led to a Darius Garland three-pointer in the final seconds.
Post-Match Reflections: Milwaukee showed resilience, but falling short by just two points highlights how a fully healthy lineup could make a difference in these close contests.
If the Bucks can get healthy — a challenge they’ve faced all season — there’s reason to believe they can turn things around.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Milwaukee Bucks have now dropped to 1-6.
The Bucks have not had an easy start, playing five of their first seven games on the road.
Eight of their next ten games will be at home, which could give them the boost they need to reset and gain some momentum.
Others: Giannis Antetokounmpo sat out due to a strained adductor muscle.
Khris Middleton, whose return date remains uncertain.
The Bucks return to Fiserv Forum to face the struggling Utah Jazz.
